column1: HUT 8 RIVERBEND - DATA HALL COMMISSIONING WBS
Project: Hut 8 Riverbend Data Center - 224 MW Facility
Scope: Level 1-3 Commissioning Oversight for Single 36 MW Data Hall Block
Levels Covered: L1 (Documentation) | L2 (Installation Verification) | L3 (Pre-Functional Testing Oversight)

column7: Electrical systems oversight: transformers, switchgear, UPS, batteries, power distribution
Mechanical systems oversight: chillers, CDUs, CRAH units, cooling systems, TAB oversight
Program oversight, vendor coordination, client interface, schedule management. Oversees and directs L1-L3 activities.
Documentation QA/QC, report generation, submittal tracking, scheduling support. Full-time during L1-L3 phase.

column1: Note: This is oversight and coordination only. GC performs actual L1-L3 commissioning activities per RFP scope definition.
RFP SCHEDULE FOR 36 MW BLOCK (PER RFP PAGE 2)

column7: RFP states Levels 1-3 performed by GC under CxA responsibility and oversight
RFP specifies 6-week maximum duration for Level 4-IST phase

column1: Assumption for L1-L3 Duration: 4-5 weeks based on industry standards for 36 MW data hall

column2: Total L1-L3: 4-5 weeks (using 5 weeks for this WBS)

column1: Note: RFI-001.02 requests clarification on L1-3 oversight scope definition
WORK BREAKDOWN STRUCTURE - L1-L3 OVERSIGHT (5 WEEKS)

column2: Block kickoff meeting with GC and Owner
Review GC commissioning plan and schedule
Establish communication protocols and reporting structure
Define witness points and hold points for L1-L3 activities
Setup commissioning management platform (CxAlloy or Facility Grid)
Review MV switchgear submittals (RMUs and switchboards)
Review rack power distribution submittals (160 RPPs + 7 RDPs)
Review CRAH fan wall submittals (47 units total)
Review hot aisle containment submittals (11 units)
Review design drawings and single-line diagrams
Review control system architecture and sequences
Review O&M manuals for all equipment
Review test procedures prepared by GC for L3 activities
Document submittal exceptions and required clarifications
MV switchgear installation verification (RMUs and switchboards)
Battery cabinet installation verification (351 units - sampling)
Verify cable terminations and torque requirements
Verify clearances per NEC and NFPA 70E
CRAH fan wall installation verification (47 units)
Hot aisle containment installation verification (11 units)
Verify isolation valve accessibility and labeling
Document installation deficiencies and punch list
Photo documentation of installations and deficiencies
Witness UPS pre-functional tests (113 units - sampling)
Witness rack power distribution pre-functional tests (sampling)
Verify protective device settings loaded per coordination study
Witness alarm and monitoring system checks
Witness CRAH fan wall pre-functional tests (47 units)
Witness pressure testing of piping systems (by others)
Witness flush and fill of piping systems (by others)
Witness hot aisle containment functional checks
Witness monitoring system communications and points mapping
Define witness points with GC (critical tests requiring CxA presence)
Review GC test reports for non-witnessed testing
Statistical sampling approach for repetitive equipment
Prepare Level 3 Pre-Functional Testing Oversight Report
Review and approve GC test reports
Document exceptions and deficiencies requiring resolution
Prepare punch list for resolution before L4 start
Outstanding punch list review with GC and Owner

column6: On-site oversight of electrical equipment installation and pre-functional testing
On-site oversight of mechanical equipment installation and pre-functional testing
Program oversight, GC coordination, client interface (hybrid/remote)
Submittal tracking, report generation, documentation QA/QC (hybrid/remote)

column4: Electrical equipment submittal review, installation verification, pre-functional testing oversight
Mechanical equipment submittal review, installation verification, pre-functional testing oversight, TAB plan oversight
Schedule coordination, GC interface, vendor coordination, issue resolution
Submittal tracking, report generation, photo documentation, punch list management
Mobilization, kickoff meeting, documentation review startup
Submittal review (electrical and mechanical equipment), design drawing review, test procedure review
Physical installation verification begins (electrical systems, transformers, switchgear, UPS)
Physical installation verification continues (mechanical systems, chillers, CDUs, CRAH, piping)
Pre-functional testing oversight (witness GC testing), L1-L3 closeout, L4 readiness assessment

column1: Review and approve GC commissioning plan, schedule, and procedures
Review equipment submittals and O&M documentation
column2: Submit equipment documentation for CxA review

column1: Witness and verify physical equipment installation (sampling)
Define witness points for pre-functional testing
column2: Perform all pre-functional testing per approved procedures
column3: Punch list of deficiencies requiring resolution

column2: Provide test reports to CxA for review

column1: Review GC test reports for non-witnessed testing
column2: Resolve all deficiencies before L4 handoff
column3: Weekly progress reports and issues log

column1: Document deficiencies and punch list items

column2: Achieve substantial completion of installation and L3 testing

column1: Note: "Oversight" means CxA reviews GC work product and witnesses critical activities but does not perform hands-on L1-L3 commissioning
Question: Will CxA have tag approval authority for equipment/system turnover from L3 to L4?
Scenario A: CxA has tag approval authority

column2: If CxA has authority to approve equipment tags, then CxA must verify all L1-L3 activities substantially complete before issuing tag approval for L4 commissioning to proceed. This increases CxA oversight responsibility.

column1: Scenario B: Owner retains tag approval authority

column2: If Owner retains authority, CxA provides recommendation only. Owner makes final approval decision for L3→L4 handoff. This reduces CxA responsibility but may create ambiguity in handoff criteria.

column1: Assumption for this WBS: CxA provides readiness recommendation; final approval authority TBD per RFI-001.02 response

column2: 1. L1-L3 duration: 5 weeks based on industry standards for 36 MW data hall (RFP does not specify L1-L3 duration)
2. GC performs all L1-L3 commissioning execution; CxA provides oversight per RFP scope definition
3. 4 resources adequate for oversight role: 2 site-based leads + 2 remote/hybrid management/documentation
4. Witness point strategy used for L3 pre-functional testing (not 100% witness of all tests)
5. Statistical sampling used for repetitive equipment verification (e.g. 351 battery cabinets)
6. Documentation Coordinator at full-time (50 hrs/week) during L1-L3 due to heavy submittal review workload
7. Pressure testing and TAB performed by others; CxA oversight and plan review only per scope assumptions
8. CxA tag approval authority TBD per RFI-001.02 - impacts L3→L4 handoff responsibility
9. Hours assume GC has commissioning experience and provides quality work product requiring normal oversight
10. If GC commissioning quality is poor
column3: oversight hours may increase significantly (risk factor)

column4: Poor quality L1-L3 execution, extensive rework, delays to L4 start
column5: Qualify GC commissioning experience early; escalate issues immediately; budget contingency hours

column4: L4 start delayed - cascades through entire block schedule
column5: Track GC progress weekly, early warning system, contractual L3 completion requirements

column4: Cannot complete L1 review on schedule
column5: Request submittals 4-6 weeks before installation, track submittal log aggressively

column4: Extensive punch list, delays to L3 pre-functional testing
column5: Conduct L2 verification early and often, halt work if major deficiencies found

column4: Equipment not ready for L4, CxA cannot approve handoff
column5: Define witness points and hold points clearly upfront, do not approve L3 completion until substantially complete

column4: Cost overrun if oversight effort exceeds estimate, dispute over responsibility
column5: RFI-001.02 requests clarification; define oversight scope clearly in proposal assumptions

column1: Overall Risk: MEDIUM-HIGH due to dependency on GC quality and RFI-001.02 scope ambiguity
All deliverables uploaded to commissioning management platform (CxAlloy or Facility Grid per RFI-001.02)
Document: Work Breakdown Structure - Level 1-3 Oversight for Single 36 MW Block
For: Hut 8 Riverbend Data Center Commissioning Proposal
Scope: L1-L3 Commissioning Oversight (5 weeks) - 4 Resources (2 Site + 2 Remote/Hybrid)
